Summary As a fourth year student, I have grown from working on application layer and database testing towards development work in these fields. During my time at Coupons.com, I ensured the proper rendering of Coupons.com's Facebook coupon application (Brandcaster), allowing various stores to distribute their coupons through Facebook. This allowed me to gain a good understanding of front end development, including xPath, cookies, iframes, and web delivery. I also validated the PCI compliance of Coupons.com's credit card coupon system (CLOE), allowing for customers to securely use their coupons with their credit cards at local grocery stores. Here, I learned about multi-layer interactions between application and data access layers through the use of MySQL and JDBC. At Yahoo!, I enabled the proper categorization of queries to Yahoo's advertising service, improving the relevance of Yahoo's advertisements to end users. My project taught me much about modular development, as I had to ensure fluid integration of my code with code from my fellow developers. But as part of understanding the impact, I have to process the various adserving logs and do performance analysis - something very much in line with my major in bioinfomatics. During my second year at Yahoo!, I returned to help develop an autonomous reporting system for Yahoo!'s advertising service. So far, I have added the ability to access previous records through an existing monitoring UI, and created a summary page to greatly help the reporting team monitor all pipelines. I had to create my own webpages and create custom endpoint queries, increasing the productivity of the reporting team so that Yahoo! Gemini can better adjust their adverting platform to today's market. I am proud of my ability to improve customer satisfaction through my development work, as well as excited about learning about bleeding edge technology actually used in the real world, not only taught in the classroom. Experience Technical Intern II Yahoo June 2015  – Present (3 months) Sunnyvale, CA Worked on Reporting/Analytics for Yahoo's search advertising platform. Improved internal reporting tool UI to allow for accession of previous pipeline history using existing UI through inclusion of a jQuery UI Datepicker. Developed an internal summary page to view all pipeline states at once, and can access pipeline states in the past. On the front end, used Handlebars templating for HTML, and jQuery & moment.js in Javascript. Created a new endpoint in the backend in Java, and queried an Oracle database using SQL and ODBC. Currently in progress of developing an end-of-day advertisement sales report page for internal use.  Research Intern Asian Pacific Health Foundation October 2014  – Present (11 months) Greater San Diego Area Estimating Hepatitis B screening costs for the Asian Pacific Health Foundation to find cost-reduction methods, allowing for more affordable Hep. B screenings to the general public. Raising awareness for Hepatitis B through planning and execution of Hepatitis B outreach events. Utilized bilingual proficiency in Mandarin to assist in providing screenings to Mandarin-speaking patients. Processing blood samples of patients for Hepatitis B testing using centrifugation and antibody testing. Performed statistical analysis on the APHF's linkage-to-care from 2013-2014. In progress of preparing a database to store Hepatitis B clinical records for existing and future patients.  Technical Intern I Yahoo June 2014  –  September 2014  (4 months) Sunnyvale, CA Worked on advertising serving for Yahoo!. Wrote a module in C++ using internal frameworks that prevents the abuse of misused bidded keywords from advertisers. Tested the module using the CPPUnit testing framework. Used Pig Scripting to extract advertisement display and revenue data from a Hadoop FS and Google Sheets to analyse the effectiveness of my module. Software Engineering Intern Coupons.com June 2013  –  September 2013  (4 months) Mountain View, California Worked on Brandcaster Social, a tool that allows a Facebook page to post coupons from Coupons.com. Tested BrandCaster's various Coupon campaigns using JUnit and Selenium WebDriver framework on the Facebook pages of our various clients. Also worked on CLOE, a service which allows users to save coupons to their credit cards. Used ScalaTest and Selenium WebDriver to perform automated testing on CLOE front-end and the JUnit and JDBC to test a MySQL DB on the CLOE back-end. Summary I serve as the architect and manager for Yahoo's next generation streaming and batch processing systems. Problems I've dealt with focus on increasing scale, reducing latency, improving operability, focusing on customer satisfaction, while driving quality in data and engineering best practices. Systems I've worked on span from streaming to monthly data intervals. The current scale is 100 billion events/40 TB compressed input data per day. June 2011  – Present (4 years 3 months) Sunnyvale, CA I work on Y! Content Agility in building a distributed high performing storage system that stores data from various Y! properties. The modules use C++, Java, MySQL and in-house store-and-forward mechanisms to store data from different backend stores. The platform is built to consolidate all listings data and code base onto one single extensible, robust platform developed on top of a hadoop cluster. I used Java along with hibernate (to manage Java POJOs for a MySql Database), Jersey (to build a REST-ful web service running on tomcat / apache), Spring MVC framework and Quartz for job scheduling using annotations.
